imp.core.commands.encapsulation

Class CommandHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • imp.core.observer.AbstractMultiSubject
      • imp.core.commands.encapsulation.CommandHolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionLibrary, Subject

    public class CommandHolder
extends AbstractMultiSubject
implements FunctionLibrary
    Class for holding the commands to be executed on the model
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    hellmerj

      • CommandHolder

        public CommandHolder(Model model)
              throws FunctionAlreadyExists
        This is the CommandHolder constructor. It creates a new CommandHolder object and initializes the class attributes.
        Parameters:
        model - The model the commands will be executed on
        Throws:
        FunctionAlreadyExists - Thrown when an equivalent function already exists in this holder.

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(Command cmd)
        This is the addCommand method. It is responsible for adding a command to the end of the list of commands being held for execution on the model.
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command being added to the holder

      • clearModel

        public void clearModel()
        This is the clearModel method. It is responsible for resetting the model to its initial state.

      • executeCommands

        public void executeCommands()
                     throws IMPException
        This is the executeCommands method. It is responsible for invoking the execution of the commands in the holder list.
        Throws:
        IMPException - Thrown if a command being executor encounters an error.

      • getCommands

        public java.util.Queue<Command> getCommands()
        This is the getCommands method. It is a getter method for the commands list, responsible for returning a copy of the holder's command list.
        Returns:
        The queue of commands in the holder

      • getExecutedCommands

        public java.util.Queue<Command> getExecutedCommands()
        This is the getExecutedCommands method. It is a getter method for the executed commands list, responsible for returning a copy of the holder's executed command list.
        Returns:
        The queue of executed commands in the holder

      • removeCommand

        public void removeCommand(Command cmd)
                   throws InvalidParameterException
        This is the remove method. It is responsible for removing a command from the holder command list.
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command being removed from the holder
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException

      • verify

        public boolean verify()
               throws BodyNotFoundException
        This is the verify method. It is responsible for calling the model's loop finding algorithm.
        Returns:
        true if loops are valid, false otherwise
        Throws:
        LoopException - Thrown if loop finding encounters errors.
        BodyNotFoundException - Thrown if a body was not found in the loop.

      • verifyOrFail

        public void verifyOrFail()
                  throws LoopException,
                         BodyNotFoundException
        Attempt to verify the model and if it cannot, throw an exception
        Throws:
        LoopException - Thrown if loop finding encounters errors.
        BodyNotFoundException - Thrown if a body was not found in the loop.

      • compile

        public void compile()
             throws IMPException
        Compile (verify & executeCommands) the model
        Throws:
        IMPException - if any of the commands throw an exception

      • runIndefinitely

        public void runIndefinitely(int timeStep)
        Run the model with a time increment as the time step.
        Parameters:
        timeStep - the time increment.
        Throws:
        LoopException - Thrown if loop finding encounters an error.

      • run

        public void run(int timeStep,
       int maxSteps)
        Run the model with a time increment as the time step.
        Parameters:
        timeStep - the time increment.
        maxSteps - the number of time steps to run.

      • terminateThread

        public void terminateThread()
        Calling this method will terminate the thread that is used to run the model.

      • getCurrentRunningState

        public CommandHolder.runningState getCurrentRunningState()
        Returns the current state of the command holder with respect to it running.
        Returns:
        the current state.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the model if it is running. Otherwise calling this method will have no effect.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume the model if it was paused. Otherwise this method will have no effect.

      • resume

        public void resume(int timeStep,
          int numberOfTicks)
        Resumes the model from the paused state for the given amount of ticks at the given time step between each tick. After the last tick it will revert to the paused state. Once resumed it will continue to run with the timeStep previously entered.
        Parameters:
        timeStep - The amount of time that will be waited between each tick in ms.
        numberOfTicks - The number of ticks to tick for until pausing.

      • getTicks

        public double getTicks()
        Gets the ticks.
        Returns:
        the ticks

        public java.util.List<LoopHolder> getLoops()

        Returns:
        the loops

        Adds the commands.
        Parameters:
        cmds - the cmds to add

        Get the model.
        Returns:
        the model

                           throws IMPException
